headline.main: THE WARD TRAIL.; Trail of Matt, F. Ward for the Murder of Prof. Eutler, Conclusion of the Testimony. From the Louisville Courier. FOURTH DAY.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Wolfe stated the defence wished to call some witnesses. John Judt sworn--We a scholar of Butler's at the time of the difficulty; knew J.S. Pirtle ; had conversed with him about this matter; Pirtle told me that, BUtler struck Ward first; did not say he saw it; he might have heard it; I dont know how he knew it.

headline.main: THE BROADWAY CALAMITY.; Recognition of the Unclaimed Body. FUNERALS OF THREE OF THE VICTIMS. Continuation of the Coroner's Inquest-Interesting Testimony.

docs.lead_paragraph: Arrangements have been made for the proper solemnization of the Obsequies of the deceased Firemen. A grand procession will form on Sunday morning at 11 o'clock, the right resting on Fourteenth-street, and will move through the principal streets of the City. The members of the Fire Department will all appear in citizens' dress, and no banners or music will be allowed in the line.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following correspondence has taken place in consequence of the resignation of General A. CHANDLER, the late Corresponding Secretary and Agent of the Institute: To the Members of the American Institute: NEW-YORK, Wednesday, March 22, 1854.
docs.snippet: The following correspondence has taken place in consequence of the resignation of General A. CHANDLER, the late Corresponding Secretary and Agent of the Institute: To the Members of the American Institute: NEW-YORK, Wednesday, March 22, 1854.

docs.lead_paragraph: Church Intelligence. Rev. BENTON SMITH has accepted the pastoral charge of the Universalist Church in South Reading, Mass. Rev. G. W. QUINBY has closed his labors with the Universalist Society in Cincinnati, O. Rev. Mr. SLADE has resigned the pastorship of the Universalist Church in Foxboro', Mass. Rev. G. V. MAXHAM was installed pastor of the Universalist Church in Medford, Mass., April 16.

headline.main: THIRTY-THIRD CONGRESS.....First Session.; HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES.

docs.lead_paragraph: The House resumed the consideration of the bill granting lands to the several States, for internal improvement and educational purposes. Mr. ROGERS spoke throughout the morning hour, in favour of the bill. In his judgment gross injustice has been done to the old States:

headline.main: FRANCE.; POLITICAL AND MILITARY MOVEMENTS. Personal and Miscellaneous Gossip.

docs.lead_paragraph: The review in honor of the Duke of CAMBRIDGE, grandson of GEORGE III, of England, took place yesterday at the Champ de Mars. For forty-seven days not a drop of rain had fallen, and it really was curious to see the clouds gather, and just one hour before the time of meeting, burst and bespatter the city with a drenching discharge, which continued till the ceremony was over. e heavens
